title: Email 俾世界各地大學校長！！

replies.msg:
我哋draft咗封email 可以send 俾世界各地大學校長

Email list 會補上

建議大家1-25 send一封
26-50 send一封
如此類推 send曬佢

Email title: PLEASE SAVE US

Dear Chancellors and Presidents,

I am a student from a local university in Hong Kong. I might not be your student, but I am a friend of one of yours. We and the people of Hong Kong would like to ask you humbly, to stand out and voice out for the students currently in danger.

Due to recent political and social unrest, the Hong Kong Police Force has been arresting countless students and teenagers for ridiculous reasons: wearing black T-shirts, waiting for friends at streets, and even just hanging out with a group of three. There have been reported cases of student protestors or even innocent youngsters being physically tortured, sexually harassed, raped, and even murdered. We, the students, chose to fight back and protect our homeland, to fight against police’s horrid violence and brutality.

At school, we have been taught to engage ourselves in the city we are living in; to show more concern about the place we are at; to participate in our society when we still have the chance to. As of now, we have been responsive students. We are doing what our teachers asked us to and what we have learned in our studies; However, what we have received in return are blind eyes and deliberate indifference from the government, more heart-breakingly, from our university presidents.

As a student of Hong Kong, we have the responsibility to stand up for anyone indiscriminately. Why are we the ones being oppressed when we are fulfilling our missions?

The bottom line is that students' safety has to be secured. The police are now raiding various universities with armor. Please, like what Shen has done at CUHK: He protected us, he protected your students, your kids. Please save our future and our lives.

There is only one path; there’s no other way out. We have to bring justice to the students of Hong Kong for their desire to achieve democracy and their will to fight against the cold-blooded system and its forces. The only body who has the power to stop these ambushes committed by the police is the Hong Kong government, yet they chose to side with them unconditionally. May we stand side by side, and overcome this desperate state. Lest we allow Tiananmen-Square-Massacre-like tragedy to worsen.

In the words of Martin Luther King, Jr., “True peace is not merely the absence of tension: it is the presence of justice.”

Thank you for your precious time.

Best Regards,
Student

分析: 唯一救埋大方法 -- 開花

對家優勢:
武器精良

對家缺點:
只有不足1萬防暴
唔敢入校園(圍而不攻斷吾糧草，但24小時內仲安全)
現時大部分武器，人手都集中於九龍

結論: 人家有槍，一個可打100個，但係大型武器(eg水炮車)都集中於埋大，但其他地方(如狗聯辨，或各大狗屋，紅藍店)是最脆弱，利用快閃優勢，只要威脅到其他春袋，對家就要分兵離開埋大。威脅唔一定要勇武，1千人企係狗屋外就夠，對家冇人手驅散

Email Subject: PLEASE SAVE US

Dear Chancellors and Presidents,

I am a student from a local university in Hong Kong. I might not be your student, but I am a friend of one of yours. We and the people of Hong Kong would like to ask you humbly, to stand out and voice out for the students currently in peril.

Due to recent political and social unrest, the Hong Kong Police Force has been arresting countless students and teenagers for absurd reasons: wearing black T-shirts, waiting for friends at streets, and even just hanging out with a group of three. There have been reported cases of student protestors or even innocent youngsters being physically tortured, sexually harassed, sexually assaulted, and even murdered. We, the students of Hong Kong, chose to fight back and protect our homeland, to fight against police’s escalating violence and brutality.

In school, we have been taught to engage ourselves in the city we are living in; to show concern about the place we are at; to participate in our society when we still have the chance to. As of now, we have been responsive students. We are doing what our teachers asked us to and applied what we have learnt in our studies; However, what we have received in return are blind eyes and deliberate indifference from the government, and more heart-breakingly, from our university presidents.

As a student of Hong Kong, we have the responsibility to stand up for anyone indiscriminately. Why are we the ones being oppressed when we are carrying out our responsibilities?

The bottom line is that the safety of students has to be secured. The police are now raiding various universities with armed forces and lethal weapons. Please like what Prof. Joseph Jao-yiu Sung has done at CUHK: He protected your children, your students and most importantly, us. Please save our future and our lives.

There is only one path; there is no other way out. We have to bring justice to the students of Hong Kong for their desire to achieve democracy and their will to fight against the cold-blooded system and its brutal forces. The only body who has the power to stop these ambushes committed by the police is the Hong Kong government, yet they chose to side with them unconditionally. May we stand side by side, and overcome this desperate state. Lest we allow this Tiananmen-Square-Massacre-like tragedy to worsen.

In the words of Martin Luther King, Jr., “True peace is not merely the absence of tension: it is the presence of justice.”

Thank you for your precious time.

Best Regards,
A Student Fighting for Freedom in Hong Kong​

quote.msg:
Email Subject: PLEASE SAVE US

Dear Chancellors and Presidents,

I am a student from a local university in Hong Kong. I might not be your student, but I am a friend of one of yours. We and the people of Hong Kong would like to ask you humbly, to stand out and voice out for the students currently in peril.

Due to recent political and social unrest, the Hong Kong Police Force has been arresting countless students and teenagers for absurd reasons: wearing black T-shirts, waiting for friends at streets, and even just hanging out with a group of three. There have been reported cases of student protestors or even innocent youngsters being physically tortured, sexually harassed, sexually assaulted, and even murdered. We, the students of Hong Kong, chose to fight back and protect our homeland, to fight against police’s escalating violence and brutality.

In school, we have been taught to engage ourselves in the city we are living in; to show concern about the place we are at; to participate in our society when we still have the chance to. As of now, we have been responsive students. We are doing what our teachers asked us to and applied what we have learnt in our studies; However, what we have received in return are blind eyes and deliberate indifference from the government, and more heart-breakingly, from our university presidents.

As a student of Hong Kong, we have the responsibility to stand up for anyone indiscriminately. Why are we the ones being oppressed when we are carrying out our responsibilities?

The bottom line is that the safety of students has to be secured. The police are now raiding various universities with armed forces and lethal weapons. Please like what Prof. Joseph Jao-yiu Sung has done at CUHK: He protected your children, your students and most importantly, us. Please save our future and our lives.

There is only one path; there is no other way out. We have to bring justice to the students of Hong Kong for their desire to achieve democracy and their will to fight against the cold-blooded system and its brutal forces. The only body who has the power to stop these ambushes committed by the police is the Hong Kong government, yet they chose to side with them unconditionally. May we stand side by side, and overcome this desperate state. Lest we allow this Tiananmen-Square-Massacre-like tragedy to worsen.

In the words of Martin Luther King, Jr., “True peace is not merely the absence of tension: it is the presence of justice.”

Thank you for your precious time.

Best Regards,
A Student Fighting for Freedom in Hong Kong​

【請廣傳予身處理大人士】

不少消息指，今晚或會有社會賢達或政府社工獲批准進入理大，陪同或勸籲抗爭者和平離開（但很可能會被捕）。

許智峯呼籲，無論你離開的方式如何，在任何情況下，請勿向任何人表達你「投降」或「自首」，因這樣有可能影響你日後的法律權利，緊記！
